definition: to lend (sth other than money)/to borrow
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: Sorry, it's our house phone, not for outside line.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这是工作电话，不外借。

sentences.english: Dictionaries and all books in the reference stacks cannot be checked out.
sentences.chinese: 工具书和参考书书库中的所有书都不能外借。

sentences.english: The government now borrows about 42 cents of every dollar it spends.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在所花费的1美元，其中42美分需要外借。

sentences.english: B: Can I check this one out?
Private house, no mediation, old fitment, form a complete set.
sentences.chinese: 私宅外借，中介免谈，老式装修，配套齐全。

sentences.english: To avoid loss or damage, the original copy of quality system documents shall not be borrowed out.
sentences.chinese: 质量体系文件正本一律不外借，以防丢失或损环。

sentences.english: No book lending service. Copy service is available.
sentences.chinese: 本室图书资料不外借，内有影印机可使用。

sentences.english: Sorry. The items in this room may not be checked out.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，本室的资料不予外借。

sentences.english: Sorry, newspapers and periodicals are not for circulation.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，报纸和周刊是不外借的。

sentences.english: A: I’m sorry. It’s for reference only, so it must stay in the library.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这本只是参考书，不能外借。

sentences.english: Textbooks and other school material are either free or lent out.
sentences.chinese: 课本和其它学校备品都是免费的，而且可以外借。
会员卡不可转让或外借。

sentences.english: Five buildings are all books leave a stub, does not permit the external loan, but may look casually.
sentences.chinese: 五楼是所有书的留底儿，不允许外借，但可以随便看。

definition: to lend/to put out a loan
excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)
to deposit/to store/to leave sth with sb
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to store and retrieve (money, belongings etc)/(computing) to access (data)
to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
